intro: Chabrea, commonly known as the common chabrea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are alternate, simple, and often hairy. Chabrea is an annual or biennial herb that produces small, elongated pods containing several seeds. Its botanical characteristics make it a common weed in agricultural fields and disturbed soils.
